messages.body: Greetings to all!
So apparently there is an option to show the thunderwave avatar of other users but no way to set one for yourself?
Also svg images(and data uri) are ignored in Tor Browser. glightstar@kaffie.bit
caryoscelus@zeroid.bit thanks
I should now have an thunderwave avatar.
Sweet! Not sure about how I like the transparency on ayumi, though.
quantumworld@zeroid.bit What do you mean?
Hi!
nekololi@zeroid.bit Yeah it seems to update the ui really slowly. You can refresh the page right after you post and it will appear without any delay.
I made a list of all addresses of the millchan spammer and gave them to kaffie, if she adds them to her list, then it should.
sirlotaplot@zeroid.bit Pretty sure he wanted to make it useless, apparently there was that one guy that has tried repetitively to get that place shut down(and failed).
piloth@zeroid.bit No u
Hi!
It freezes for everyone, I think and I don't really understand why.You can refresh the page right after you post.
It will show you your post immediately.
Envelope is private chat, I think. No idea about arrow, though.
Definitely looking forward to that!
klu9@zeroid.bit Probably, every zite with user content has to have a `max size` property in the content.json, I think.
quantumworld@zeroid.bit Yes, I can personally confirm that.
Well, I'm here. Hi!
You mean the content updates of Thunderwave or my reply 11 hours later?
?![tc_90c26fea-cf27-41be-7436-599426358c16] Yes, shame there aren't many people using it though.
Agreed, maybe hold off on marketing on clearnet until 0.6.6 with python3 comes around. It will bring a lot of performance and security upgrades.

He said ETA would be around 3-4 weeks back in December, I think. But it apparently there was more complexity that he assumed and now it takes longer. You can follow the progress(roughly) at [this](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1773)(Clearnet) github issue.
I feel pretty human, but some would disagree on that.
spacedust@zeroid.bit Yes, but people only check in occasionally. Also: Hi!
Hi
Hi
Hi, not too much right now. How about you?
nickwa@zeroid.bit gabew@zeroid.bit No it doesn't.
Future versions might, but not right now.
As am I
Hi!
If only.
?![tc_631d6e9f-cf1e-9b5f-4d9b-c1042395ccb0] No, not yet. Probably in the future though.
See https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/57 (Clearnet for more info)

?![tc_7e03e5e9-09d6-29ff-ded9-381062ee771a] DHT stands for Distributed Hash Table. It can be used to replace trackers(and many more things). If you have a month or two to spare I suggest you read up on it. Really interesting (but involved) stuff!
?![tc_5eccc23b-7157-343b-c30f-8c3abae94812] Godspeed and longevity, my hero!
Hi!
?![tc_ce4c27c1-903a-fd6b-e4b2-4b10cdfda439] There are a few commands you can use(type `/help), among those is `/avatar`.
looks line something is wrong with the code quotes
?![tc_ae9ae68d-6d9f-8b43-ff60-893c51b16aa1] Send me an ZeroMail, if you want more info. But please keep that stuff out of the public zites.
?![tc_c2faa05e-37c5-6885-ffa3-e0879c67af57] I think so, at some point an new and improved version of ThunderWave was in development. Not sure what happened to that.
Shit, I think I accidentally deleted my entire Thunderwave  history, yesterdayâ€¦
Also, Hi!
Oh, wait looks like only the posts from yesterday were affected. Strange.
?![tc_d10d064a-52d3-3b4e-8c9f-4e0f805a93ca] Another shooting, I guess?
?![tc_a2c219cb-37ee-ea4b-cc05-0078ba6825c3] Please stop spamming it.
Hi!
As far as I know mcdev doesn't use namecoin, so just so you know millchan.bit is not under his control.
?![tc_f10ddee1-5881-c1fc-b5ef-abb3da5831da] Yes, he did
Do you mean ThunderWave X?
I found it on name.yo the other day. Looks pretty good!
Nice!
How is thunderwaveX coming along?
Not that I know of oneth@zeroid.bit

glightstar@kaffie.bit Sounds interesting, looking forward to it. Will you be rendering to HTML directly or use a framework(like vue or react)? I've been recently looking into svelte and am really impressed by it. It outperforms vue by inconceivable amounts, especially if one is on Tor Browser.
Actually on that, have you already thought about how you want to implement moderation on the hubs?
I'm working on a booru style imageboard right now and I ran into a wall with making a moderation system that is enforced on the ZeroNet level.
More info in [this](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/issues/view/?1P4w4Rvh4vS9r6G5xTiSh8qEW87EKZtnJB/12@1DfrA2M9Qra6stqT6tzwNMYNweswY54KAC) GitCenter issue, if you're interested
?![tc_1e8af77c-0e93-63c1-55a9-7f7d3c4f9765] Well this doesn't look right
glightstar@kaffie.bit Do you have the source code somewhere? I would like to take a look at it.
?![tc_956121ff-ffdc-0313-41e0-e805be5f4a66] ThunderwaveX
?![tc_eaf723fe-c4f6-9a60-16c6-7720a88bdf24] I don't, but I'm probably going to make one soon. I appreciate this not being on github, though.
Greetings!
You need to refresh in order so see your message.
